description: Borrowed from the neuter of Latin pendulus (“hanging”).

nouns.description: pendulum (plural pendulums or pendula) (See usage notes.)

definitionGroups.group: (clocks, mechanics) A body suspended from a fixed support so that it swings freely back and forth under the influence of gravity, commonly used to regulate various devices such as clocks.

entries.meaning: (by extension) Used to refer to the tendency of a situation to oscillate (between two extremes).
A lamp, etc. suspended from a ceiling.
A watch's guard-ring by which it is attached to a chain.
